ai.summary: Cown Edge Way is a 12.1 km moderate ridge hike in the UK. The route follows exposed upland ridgelines with sweeping views, combining grassy tracks with rocky sections and some ascent.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect exposed ridge terrain with uneven, rocky paths, short steeper sections, and intermittent boggy patches. The route traverses open moorland and dry stone features with occasional forested approaches.
ai.safety_notes: Weather on upland ridges can change rapidly in the UK. Wear sturdy boots, stay on marked paths, and carry navigation tools even on familiar routes. Start with a full battery and map; be prepared to turn back if visibility or wind worsens. Tell someone your plans and expected return time. Bring enough water and food, and be mindful of cold exposure on exposed sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass (or GPS) for navigation
Headlamp or torch with extra batteries
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) typically offer the best conditions for Cown Edge Way, but weather on UK ridges can be highly variable year-round.
